summary: Diff adds backend fields/migration for review documents (contentType, pros/cons arrays, rating) and introduces frontend utilities plus CreateReviewPage UI/state to capture and save these fields. However, the requested editor-toolbar dropdown and robust load/restore behavior for existing documents are not evidenced, and some added logic (rating normalization/clamping) goes beyond stated requirements.

missing_requirements.requirement: Ensure backend create/save and fetch/query APIs persist and return contentType/pros/cons/rating with safe defaults when missing (news / [] / [] / 0).
missing_requirements.reason: The diff shows type changes and a migration, but does not show the actual backend API functions (create/save/fetch/query) being updated to apply defaults on read/write for older records (or to guarantee non-null values in returned frontend types). backend/main.mo is truncated before any relevant API implementations.
evidence: backend/main.mo (truncated; only type additions visible, not API logic)

missing_requirements.requirement: In the document editor UI, provide a dropdown in the top toolbar with exactly two options (News/Review), default News, persisted per document and reflected when loading.
missing_requirements.reason: The only evidenced UI change is a contentType select on CreateReviewPage; there is no evidence of a dropdown in the editor top toolbar, nor evidence it is wired to load an existing document and reflect stored contentType.

missing_requirements.requirement: Conditionally render Pros/Cons/Rating fields outside the rich-text editor only when contentType=review; hide for news; render/hide immediately on dropdown change and correctly on load.
missing_requirements.reason: CreateReviewPage defines state for pros/cons/rating and computes isReviewType, but the JSX where these fields are conditionally rendered is truncated, and there is no evidence of load behavior for an existing saved document.

missing_requirements.requirement: Persist Pros/Cons/Rating on save and restore them on load; pros/cons stored as arrays; frontend must serialize/deserialize deterministically (textarea <-> array).
missing_requirements.reason: Saving path is partially evidenced (textareaToArray used on submit), but there is no evidence of restoring pros/cons/rating into the form when loading an existing document, and no evidence that arrayToTextarea is used anywhere for deserialization/population.

hallucinated_features.description: Rating normalization/clamping to a 0–100 range with rounding.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest specifies rating as a simple number with default 0 and explicitly calls out 'No advanced calculations or derived logic for the rating field.' Introducing clamping/rounding to 0–100 is additional behavior not requested.
